title: New North Church, Edinburgh
author: Livingston, Josiah.
snippet: My first recollection of going to church in Edinburgh (no doubt I had been properly "practised" inthe country) is a very vivid one. We lived in Buccleuch Place. Our route to church was a lane calledWindmill Lane, which had many stables in it; thislane is bisected by a cross street called WindmillStreet, at the eastern end whereof there is a junctionof several streets, of which the narrowest and dingiestis the Potterrow.
